DOCNAME: CASE OF HOUSING ASSOCIATION OF WAR DISABLED AND VICTIMS OF WAR OF ATTICA AND OTHERS v. GREECE
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection dismissed (six month period);Violation of P1-1;Just satisfaction reserved
TEXT: CARDINAL . The first applicant was set up in DATE by disabled Second World War veterans and relatives of soldiers who died in that war with the aim of providing housing to its members . It raised its capital by means of ORG contributions .

CARDINAL . In DATE , by deed no . DATE , the first applicant bought QUANTITY . m in the area of PERSON in Cholargos , for a total of MONEY . The Government claimed that the land did not belong to the persons who had sold it to the applicants but to the ORG . They relied in this connection on a judgment issued in DATE by ORG . The applicants contested this view . They stressed that the DATE judgment had been delivered after the exchange of their land in DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , namely after they had transferred to the ORG all their possible claims against the former owners of their land , and that in any event they had purchased this land in good faith and at market value .

CARDINAL . In DATE the land was requisitioned without compensation for the needs of ORG . After an application by the association , ORG ruled that the requisition was null and void because it was serving permanent and not temporary needs ( judgment no . CARDINAL ) . In DATE , as a result of this judgment , the ORG bought the unlawfully requisitioned land and exchanged it with QUANTITY . m of land owned by ORG in the nearby area of ORG . The area was public woodland outside the boundaries of the urban development plan . According to the applicants , the understanding was that the association would be allowed to develop it after the ORG had issued the appropriate changes to the local planning regulations . The first applicant paid CARDINAL drachma per sq . m to cover the difference in value between the old and the new land . The relevant decision approving the contract of sale and exchange was retroactively validated by virtue of LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL ) . The Government asserted that the above price was symbolic and that at the relevant time the market value of the land was CARDINAL drachmas per sq . m. Therefore , they considered that the land in question had been donated to the applicants . The applicants contended that this assertion was false .

CARDINAL . On DATE a Royal Decree included the land in the revised urban development plan , following a proposal by ORG and an affirmative opinion by ORG sitting in an administrative capacity with the power to give a non - binding advisory opinion .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE Legislative Decree no . TIME declassified the land from being reafforestable ( άρση αναδάσωσης ) . Further , the Minister of Agriculture issued a license for building roads and cutting down trees in order to implement the new town plan . In DATE the applicant association started transferring plots of land to its members and applied to ORG for an altitude study , which was necessary under NORP law for the implementation of the urban development plan . The first building licenses were also issued .
CARDINAL . In DATE LAW introduced new rules for the protection of the environment ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . In DATE ORG rejected the association ’s application for an altitude study . Further , the Minister of Agriculture requested that the Minister of Public Works revoke the DATE LAW whereby the planning zone had been extended to the land owned by the first applicant , for the reason that it had been issued without the assent of ORG even though the area “ was a forest ” . In DATE the Minister of Public Works replied that he would not revoke the decree because it had already been applied for DATE and had been relied upon by third parties ( decision no . ΓCARDINAL/CARDINAL/CARDINAL.CARDINAL.CARDINAL ) . He then issued a new decision approving the detailed zoning plan ( ρυμοτομικό σχέδιο ) and the altitude study . On an application by ORG , ORG found both decisions illegal . It held in particular that under LAW the protection of the forest was more important than the expectations created by the fact that the land had already been in the process of being developed ( judgment no . GPE ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister of Planning , Housing and the Environment gave a new decision which repeated in substance the annulled decision concerning the detailed zoning plan and the altitude study . ORG again applied to ORG , which quashed the new decision as well , considering that following its earlier ruling the administration had to revoke the zoning decree or give new reasons for not doing so ( judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) . A third - party appeal ( τριτανακοπή ) by the first applicant was dismissed by ORG ( judgment no . DATE ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE a Presidential Decree abolished the DATE LAW in so far as it extended the urban development plan to the association ’s land . Members of the association brought their case unsuccessfully before ORG which on DATE ruled that , even if LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) had ratified the inclusion of a forest in a zoning area , such law would have been considered to have been abrogated by virtue of LAW ( judgment no . DATE ) .
CARDINAL . DATE the first applicant undertook various initiatives which aimed at a settlement of its dispute with the ORG but to no avail .
CARDINAL . In DATE ORG of GPE issued a decision declaring that the first applicant ’s land was a forest according to the Forests Code .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant association and CARDINAL of its members invited the ORG to exchange the association ’s land for new land of equal value belonging to the ORG , or to expropriate it , according to the provisions of PERSON no . PERSON ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . The authorities did not reply .

CARDINAL . On DATE the case was brought before ORG . The applicants referred to the history of the proceedings and inter alia argued that their property had been interfered with for DATE with no compensation whatsoever . Coming to the current situation , they stressed that Presidential Decree of DATE , and the interpretation of NORP CARDINAL § CARDINAL and CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Constitution as set out in the DATE judgment and in the jurisprudence of ORG , made clear that it was no longer possible to build on their land . Such interference was even more odious in view of the aims of the association which was the provision of appropriate housing for its members , an aim that had now come to nought , despite the great amounts of money and time invested in it by the association and its members . The applicants claimed that according to the provisions of PERSON no . CARDINAL they were entitled to compensation for the deprivation of their right to use their property for the purposes for which they had bought it . Thus , by refusing to exchange their land for new land of equal value , or to expropriate it , the ORG had violated Articles CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Constitution and CARDINAL of Protocol No . CARDINAL to the Convention .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , by a majority , dismissed the application on the ground that the relevant provisions of LAW no . CARDINAL were unconstitutional . In particular , it held that , “ by providing for the possibility of expropriating or exchanging woodland which can not become a residential area , LAW presupposes that the urban development of woodland is in principle lawful , something which is contrary to LAW . However , one judge expressed the opinion that the expropriation or the exchange of land which was purchased before the entry into force of LAW was not contrary to it ( judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) . The judgment was certified ( θεώρηση ) on DATE .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the LAW , which came into force on DATE , read as follows :
“ CARDINAL . ORG is protected by the ORG ; rights deriving therefrom , however , may not be exercised contrary to public interest .

CARDINAL . No one shall be deprived of his property except in the public interest , which must be duly shown , when and as specified by law and always following full compensation corresponding to the value of the expropriated property at the time of the court hearing on the provisional determination of compensation . In cases in which a request for the final determination of compensation is made , the value at the time of the court hearing of the request shall be considered ... ”

“ The protection of the natural and cultural environment is an obligation of the ORG . The ORG is bound to take special preventive or repressive measures for the preservation of the environment . Matters pertaining to the protection of forests and woodland in general shall be regulated by law . It is forbidden to alter the status and use of ORG forests and woodland , except where agricultural development or other use is paramount for the national economy and serves the public interest . ”

“ The expropriation of forests or woodland that belong to private individuals or corporations is allowed only for the benefit of the ORG , according to LAW [ which provides the conditions for the taking of property ] , for the public interest ; their status as forests or woodlands is not thereby changed . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant section of PERSON no . CARDINAL reads as follows :

“ ORG and private woodland belonging to ORG at the time of entry into force of this law and which can not lawfully become a residential area or be included in such an area according to [ § § CARDINAL and CARDINAL of this Section ] , shall be expropriated by the ORG at the expense of ORG , or shall be exchanged with land of equal value or other vacant land which is under the management of ORG and has been included in a residential area according to current legislation . The expropriation shall take place by virtue of a joint decision of ORG and Agriculture , on the basis of an opinion by ORG ... ”

In DATE ORG held that “ in its true meaning [ LAW no . CARDINAL ] regulated the status of private forests and woodland purchased by housing associations ” ; it thus considered that the above provision was not applicable in a case where land was donated to a housing association ( judgment no . TIME ) .
